bool AllowApplicationForms [get, set]
 Allows the application to attempt to post async replies over the application "main loop" by using the message queue of the first available open form (window). This is retrieved through Application.OpenForms.
System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke InvokeableObject [get, set]
 Set the ISynchronizeInvoke object to use as the invoke object. When returning results from asynchronous calls, the Invoke method on this object will be called to pass the results back in a thread safe manner.
bool AllowMultithreadedCallbacks [get, set]
 If this is set to true, AllowApplicationForms is set to false and InvokeableObject is set to null, any time an asynchronous method needs to invoke a method in the main loop, it will instead run the method in its own thread.

Detailed Description

The base class used by the NetServiceBrowser and NetService classes. This class primarily abstracts the asynchronous functionality of its derived classes.

It should not be necessary to derive from this class directly.

Property Documentation

bool ZeroconfService.DNSService.AllowApplicationForms [get, set]

Allows the application to attempt to post async replies over the application "main loop" by using the message queue of the first available open form (window). This is retrieved through Application.OpenForms.

Definition at line 106 of file DNSService.cs.

System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke ZeroconfService.DNSService.InvokeableObject [get, set]

Set the ISynchronizeInvoke object to use as the invoke object. When returning results from asynchronous calls, the Invoke method on this object will be called to pass the results back in a thread safe manner.

This is the recommended way of using the DNSService class. It is recommended that you pass your main form (window) in.

Definition at line 123 of file DNSService.cs.

Referenced by Crossfade.P2PDB.start().

bool ZeroconfService.DNSService.AllowMultithreadedCallbacks [get, set]

If this is set to true, AllowApplicationForms is set to false and InvokeableObject is set to null, any time an asynchronous method needs to invoke a method in the main loop, it will instead run the method in its own thread.

The thread safety of this property depends on the thread safety of the underlying dnssd.dll functions. Although it is not recommended, there are no known problems with this library using this method.

However, if your application uses Windows.Forms or any other non-thread safe library, you will have to do your own invoking.

Definition at line 146 of file DNSService.cs.
